Posts.Content: I have been having pains in my legs /groin/lower back for months. Went to see my GP and her referred me to Musculo Skeletal team. I had a thorough examination and was referred for MRI scan,which i had yesterday (1/3) afternoon.This afternoon the lady who i saw at Musculo Skeletal rang me, there was no major concern with my back,but there are things she needs to discuss with me regarding pelivs and hip, and she also threw into the mix I have a mass on my right ovary,for which she has referred me back to my GP for him to refer me to Gynae.   Am I being a fruit cake worrying that the results came back so quick and that i cause for concern regarding it all? I have app to see Musculo lady on Tuesday,and am to ring my GP Monday to give him time to read the report she has sent to him. I am in turmoil now. What next can happen, after getting over BC and getting on with life I have this spanner thrown into the works.
Posts.Title: MRI scan results

Posts.Content: The worry never ends, i am more prone to thinking the worst because the mri results were so quick
Posts.Title: MRI scan results

Posts.Content: So sorry, Everything seems to snowball doesn't it,and there's very little we can do but ride it out. Keep strong and take one day at a time,YOU are the most important one at this time. Get the rads out the way and then focus on everything else,it is tiring enough without having to cope with other issues. As for the cream, I used E45 and aloe Vera which helped me with the slight burn. Hope you can keep your pecker up and we are all here for you at anytime x Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Bloody doctor

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Just letting you know my recent CT scan has come back clear, possible costochondritis that is causing all the pain xx Begins with C but isn't the BIG C so very very thankful xxx
Posts.Title: The results are in!

Posts.Content: Hi all, Just to give an update. After waiting 4 weeks for bone can results to be told it had to go to MDT meeting which was today, I finally got a call from my BCN to tell me that there were "hot spots" on my ribs,chest wall and shoulder and that a CT scan was needed for further imaging before a diagnosis can be made. So now have to wait for that appointment to come through (which will be within the next 2 weeks) and await that result!! Although she did say that once i had had it,to let her know and she will chase the results up. Been scared witless for weeks thinking today i would get to know what's happening, and now i'm even more worried. am i reading too much into it do you think??  Thanks Elaine #waitingdrivesuscrazy
Posts.Title: Still the waiting game

Posts.Content: Thankyou for replying, I have to wait and see, i get that, but to know there is someone who has been through a similar thing and come out the other side (i won't say unscathed), but here to help the likes of me is a real help. I tell mine and get "oh well don't think about it,it could be nothing", Well yea i know!!!!! But once you have had cancer it's always there that it's back! that's what they don't understand so thankyou again x
Posts.Title: Still the waiting game

Posts.Content: Thanks, It is a worrying time, all what if's and maybe's. Was your Ct ok? x
Posts.Title: Still the waiting game

Posts.Content: Mine started a few days before my 2nd cycle and it was the night of my works xmas party, i brushed out what i could and donned the wig. got fab comments at the party! As for all the other areas,that went after my 2nd cycle but it was winter so i wouldn't of been shaving my legs anyway! lol x
Posts.Title: Curious about when my hair will fall out.

Posts.Content: Thanks Julia, I have left a message on their answer machine to ring me. I'm just not sure if this pain is normal so long after surgery and i don't want to waste any a GP appt if it is normal hopefully they will call me back today.  Thanks again Elaine x
Posts.Title: Breast and arm pain

Posts.Content: Saw the surgeon this afternoon and he is referring me for a bone scan :(
Posts.Title: Breast and arm pain

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Just after a bit of advice.  I am 2 years post lumpectomy and have had numbness and tingling in my upper arm ever since. The last week or so I have been having severe pain both in my arm and the affected breast. Would you see the GP or call the breast care nurses? Only asking because my oncologist always says any pain see your GP. Thanks for any advice
Posts.Title: Breast and arm pain

Posts.Content: Spoke to BC nurse and she has made me an appointment to see my surgeon tomorrow
Posts.Title: Breast and arm pain

Posts.Content: Hi all, after complaining about bone pain to my oncologist for a year and half (to be told, buy some ibuprofen it's pennies in the shops), I saw my surgeon last week who referred me straight away for a bone scan,which is next Wednesday. Now i'm scared there is something wrong which my oncologist deemed not fit to look into. My mum was diagnosed too late for treatment and passed away 9 days after diagnosis. Can you understand my fear? Or am i over thinking this? Thanks Elaine x
Posts.Title: Is it bone mets?

Posts.Content: Hi Julia, The pains are in my hips,groin and lower legs. I've been on Letrozole for near;y 2 years,and I am aware that it can cause joint pains etc, but the pain has got more intense,to the point i'm scared to go to bed at night it get's so painful. The last week or so has had me in tears and i haven't cried in a long long time! Just have to wait and see what the outcome is and take it from there i guess. Thnks for your reply x
Posts.Title: Is it bone mets?

Posts.Content: Hi all, have a quick question regarding ESA claims. On the questionnaire it asks are you having or recovering from cancer treatment. My question is, what do the deem as recovering from cancer treatment? And how long do we recover for? Is hormone therapy classed as still being treated for cancer? Sorry tha'ts 3 questions not 1, Interested to hear what you think. Thanks  Elaine
Posts.Title: ESA and cancer treatment

Posts.Content: Thank you I will, I was just wandering if anyone else had the dilemma when filling in the dreaded forms x
Posts.Title: ESA and cancer treatment
